sentences.english: Rose let me introduce my friend to you.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯，让我先容一下我的朋侪。

sentences.english: I have a letter of introduction here.
Allow me to introduce myself. I am Wang Dong.
sentences.chinese: 请让我自我先容一下，我是王东。

sentences.english: I'm very happy to introduce myself to you here.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴在这儿向大家作自我先容。

sentences.english: I used to stand in front of a mirror and interview myself.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经站在一个镜子前先容我本身。

sentences.english: Do good client to molding department reception work and bear with propaganda work.
sentences.chinese: 搞好客户来注塑部的接待工作和先容宣传工作。

sentences.english: On being introduced to somebody a British person often shakes hands.
sentences.chinese: 英国人被先容给别人的时候常常和对方握握手。

sentences.english: We're going to practice greeting each other and introduction ourselves in English .
sentences.chinese: 我们将练惯用英语彼此问候和先容自己。

sentences.english: Here is a price list together with a booklet illustrating our products.
sentences.chinese: 这儿有一份价目单和先容阐明我方产品的小册子。

sentences.english: Terai said he had received more than 900 inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 据寺井先容，至今他已收到900多人的询问。

sentences.english: First, let me introduce myself to your.
sentences.chinese: 起首，请答应我先容一下本身到你的。

sentences.english: I'm just calling to introduce mycocky. My name is Tang.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话是向您作自我先容，我姓唐。

sentences.english: We wish to introduce ourselves to you as a sate-owned corporation dealing exclusively in light industrial goods.
sentences.chinese: 很兴奋向你先容我司为一家专业生产灯具的国有企业。

sentences.english: We watched a certain opportunity that featured performa certaince art onTVlast night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚有一个电视节目先容了展现派艺术。

sentences.english: The second chapter is devoted to the design of ID card should know the basic principle.
sentences.chinese: 第二章先容了预设ID卡应知道的基本的道理。

sentences.english: Director Yao of the liquor monopoly management office of Shenzhen Bureau of Trade and Industry introduces.
sentences.chinese: 深圳市贸工局酒类专卖办理办公室姚主任先容。

definition: to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
ladies and gentlemen/all of you present
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
keep calm, don't get excited/don't be impatient
One who does not know is not guilty/If one does not know any better, one cannot be held responsible
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
truth to tell/to be quite honest...
